intro: Sericocoma pungens, commonly known as the spiny sericocoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, spiny leaves and produces yellow to orange flower heads that attract pollinators. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Sericocoma pungens is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
